column4: Hey is there any way to send mplayer to the background while playing music?
i'm just using the bash shell and no X server  and want to irc or finch
yes, add & to the end of the command you're running.
yep, though you can put a space before the &.
and mplayer file not found; but only when i use the &
are you using the bash shell?
bash 3.1 or whatever the newest is
well just sayin that command wont work
huh. i don't know why that wouldn't work. you ran like this?     mplayer file.mp3 &
says cannot connect to socket then crashes mplayer
i did tell you that earlier :)
